column5: Using your credit card would get you the best exchange rate......I doubt that the motel would be even close.

It is actually a base for an outfitter that fishes numerous lakes. She usually has an empty cabin. There also is a more traditional motel. There have been times we had a room in the motel and a cabin. She kind of goes by how many people. Fish On! Hooks

I see Hotel 105 Bar and Grill on the map and it shows it's just north of Vermillion Bay a few miles. But the address says Ear Falls, ON in the search bar on google. See attachments. Can anyone clarify for me?
I believe this one is right in Ear Falls on the west side of the highway. Later, Jay
We have stayed at a place called Trillium Motel in ear falls before but haven't heard of this other place. Sounds like our group found a place. Thanks for the help

I had trouble getting anyone to answer the phone at Northside. Finally left a message and she never returned my call. So I called Pine Grove and Gail was very accommodating and very reasonable. There are 12 of us, so we are very happy to find this place.
let's see, you don't answer your phone and you over charge for a room that you can hear your neighbor fart in, OH YEAH, I've got a room for YOU! Pine Grove will do you right....
No Love for the TEE PEE ???
She has a strip of motel rooms and cabins, a little of both
Would appreciate any suggestions for motels in Vermillion Bay. I am aware that there are a couple, just hoping someone could offer some help in choosing. Just saying one night only. Thanks, Pat T
North Side Motel seems to be popular.........

couple years back I was looking at a piece of property outside Vermilion Bay, the first night I stayed with a friend who is a local ( lives on 105) the 2nd night I wanted a motel, since I was returning to the states and leaving at 4 in the morning, my buddy called the northsde and was quoted 59 dollars for the night, when I got there a couple of hours later the blonde owner charged me 79 dollars, after she saw I was from the states, She gave me the American discount!!!!! This was in Oct. and the place was dead, I don't do business (any) in Vermilion Bay anymore, Dryden is right down the road!!!!
I don't blame ya for not wanting to go to VB Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk
The envious die not once, but as oft as the envied win applause. Baltasar Gracian
+1 Northside Motel 807-227-5339 owners name is Cindy (she bought the Motel a couple years ago).
I just called up there. We wouldnt have a problem paying $79, but was told it would be $109 which includes tax. Pretty steep for mid Sept if you ask me.
We often stay at Pine Grove. Gail holds it to about $35/guy. We usually have our own cabin. The trains are our alarm clock! Hooks

I guess $80 would be fair. Didnt realize the exchange rate was that good. Might be worth another call up there to double-check. Regarding Pine Grove are you suggesting that these are small cabins as opposed to a motel?
